ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You'll have about 30 minutes to an hour of homework every night, but it's definitely rewarding. I felt like I made the transition from kind of speaking Spanish to being fluent this year.
I kinda took it to fulfill requirements, kinda took it because I like languages... at this point of learning spanish is was a good way to round out my knowledge of it.
Continuation of concepts learned in Spanish 3

A work-intensive course that will equip a student with much more confidence in Spanish. I entered the course feeling uncomfortable about speaking Spanish. By the oral final at the end, I felt confident about my capacity to carry on a conversation.
Span 140 emphasizes conversational speaking and was incredibly beneficial in my development towards fluency.

Spanish 140 was an excellent class! We reviewed a lot of grammar, as well as learned a number of new, more complex tenses. However, we also read a lot of interesting readings, some fiction some nonfiction, which made the class very interesting as each day was something new. In addition there were a number of different presentations which made definitely improved my speaking abilities. I really liked Spanish 140 and it truly helped me improve my reading, speaking and writing abilities.
